vocabularyCards.meaning: to be late / to do something late
description: Used when talking about time – when someone or something is delayed or not on time.
It's about being late, not about the speed of something.

examples.english: I went to bed too late.
If you go now, you'll be late.

description: Used when a machine, device, or system doesn't work properly, even if it looks fine on the outside.
Focus = functional failure (not necessarily physical damage).
English equivalents: to break down, to malfunction, to stop working.

examples.english: My computer isn't working / My computer broke down.

description: N을/를 움직이다 = to move (body part) - transitive
N을/를 옮기다 = to move something, to relocate, to carry
Used when moving objects from one place to another
Used for learning skills, subjects, or information
Can be used with -고 있다 for progressive learning
Often used with -에서 (from) to indicate source of learning
